item.title: Dispatch from COLM
item.description: blogpost-other COLM was a blast! Some interesting papers First, I’ll give a rundown of a few cool posters I checked out---rather than giving a comprehensive overview I’m giving my takeaways.

item.title: Wtf is a persona?!
item.description: Sometimes “persona” in LMs refers to an output persona, ie the thing that describes the human-like behavior the LM is supposed to simulate Other times it refers to input personas, ie the data that models the kind of users the LM is interacting with (in lieu of fully real interactions with the model ...

item.title: Spurious rewards
item.description: paper-notes links Code reasoning caused by RLVR (one sample RL paper) Code reasoning also caused just by random rewards “Compound” reward: we still give spurious reward but don’t reward generating python Code reasoning behavior removed Performance drops! When we do induce code reasoning: Performance...

item.title: Fluid Language model benchmarking
item.description: Blog post Paper From Ai2 benchmarking paper-notes evaluation, COLM 2025 Motivation Item response theory: a test question is most informative when its tailored to the capabilities of the student.

item.title: Talk abstract
item.description: I will present a line of work on evaluating and improving the multilingual and multicultural performance of text-to-image (T2I) models.

item.title: Quantifying Variance in Evaluation Benchmarks
item.description: paper-notes By Lovish, paper done with Dieuwke Hupkes at Meta. Paper This paper cautions against using IRT to reduce variance.
